FILE: cm365373v11.0.txt
DYAD: RUSSIA/USSR - AZERBAIJAN
RIVALRY: RIV984
DISPUTE(S): MID3564 MID4338 

PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20191116
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20191116

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3564 

TERRMID: MID3564 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3564 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3564 from Gibler 2018, this is the Nagorno-Karabach War, a territorial dispute between Azerbaijan and Armenia. Russia became involved in this war by supporting Armenia against zerbaijan and eventually helped negotiate a cease fire. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID3564 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3564 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3564 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3564 the Nagorno-Karabach conflict also involves separatist rebels who fight against both states in an attempt to secure their own state. Here, rebel groups organized along ethnic lines fought against government forces in Azerbaijan and other ethnic groups. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3564 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3564 coded civil war link because this also involved militarized rebels in Armenia, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID3564 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3564 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4338 

TERRMID: MID4338 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4338 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4338 from cm narrative, Azerbaijan seized a plane belonging to a Russian company on the grounds that its cargo, spare MIG-21 plane parts, was en route to Yugoslavia in spite of the embargo against that state. This was during the Yugoslav Wars. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to the Yugoslav Wars, a territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID4338 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4338 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4338 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4338 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4338 this MID is connected to the Yugoslav Wars, outside this dyad, which featured militarized ehtnic groups organized along ethnic lines. 

COUPMID: MID4338 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4338 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4338 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4411 

TERRMID: MID4411 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4411 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4411 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4411 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4411 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4411 from cm narrative, On 5/23/2002, the Russian Federal Border Guard Service deployed reserves to the border with Georgia and Azerbaijan. The purpose of the deployment was to defend against Chechen rebel attempts to enter Russia from Georgia or Azerbaijan. Coded civil war MID because this was conected to militarized rebel groups targeting and attacking the Russian government. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4411 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4411 although there were rebels present on Georgian and Azerbaijani territory, these Chechen rebels were not targeting these host countries and no civil conflcit activity occurred in the host countries. 

COUPMID: MID4411 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4411 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4411 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4411
rivalry=365373 nationa=RUSSIA/USSR nationb=AZERBAIJAN MID4411 20020523-20020523 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

On 5/23/2002, the Russian Federal Border Guard Service deployed reserves to the border with Georgia and Azerbaijan. The purpose of the deployment was to defend against Chechen rebel attempts to enter Russia from Georgia or Azerbaijan. First day of dispute was on 5/23/2002 and last day of dispute was on 5/23/2002.

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4338
rivalry=365373 nationa=AZERBAIJAN nationb=RUSSIA/USSR MID4338 19990319-19990330 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Azerbaijan seized a plane belonging to Russian company on the grounds that its cargo, spare MIG-21, plane parts was en route to Yugoslavia in spite of the embargo against that state. First day of dispute was on 3/19/1999 and last day of dispute was on 3/30/1999.

RIVNOTES:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
